Code4Lib NYS 2016 Unconference

Thursday & Friday, August 4-5, 2016 at Cornell University, Ithaca, New York


Find Out More Take Part! Schedule Code of Conduct Logistics Sponsors Contact

Code4Lib NYS 2016 Midsummer Meeting

We're planning a Code4Lib New York State (NYS) regional meeting & unconference on August 4-5, 2016. This meeting will be held at Mann Library, Cornell University. The 2-days will be a mix of scheduled/planned and impropmtu sessions, workshops, lightning talks, break out sessions, and hackathons.

A call for sessions, interests and proposals will go out on the Code4Lib National, New York State, and New York City listservs in mid-March. Information on a schedule and registration will go out this Spring. If you are interested now in helping organize the event, please email Christina Harlow, check out our public planning document, and/or join the C4L NYS 2016 Planning Google Group.

Take Part!

Help Organize/Volunteer

Interested in helping us organize this event? Join the C4L NYS 2016 Planning Google Group and share your talents.

C4LNYS 2016 Org Group

Register to Attend

Registration will be free, but limited to a certain number. Registration will be made available on this site later in the Spring.

Register (Open this Spring)

Propose a Session

Use the interactive schedule (below) to view the proposed and prepared sessions, express interest in breakouts, sign up for a lightning talk, or propose your own sessions! Explanations of the format and mix of impromptu and prepared sessions can be found in that interactive schedule. There will be a chance to propose and vote on sessions at the event as well.

Schedule

Schedule & How to Propose a Session

About and How to Propose

Below is the general schedule for the Code4Lib New York State Event, but youâ€™re encouraged to read and add your ideas, proposals, interest, or comments to the interactive schedule (this opens an editable Google Document at http://bit.ly/c4lNYS16sched).

We want this event to be a mix of both unscheduled and impromptu sessions as well as prepared workshops and presentations. This can help bring folks together to work, learn and play, but also frame the work (and play) being done. Prepared sessions and speakers will be added as they are confirmed.

Schedule Overview

Day 1: Thursday, August 4th
9 AM to Noon Workshop 1 Part 1 Workshop 2 Part 1 WriteTheDocs Part 1
Noon to 1:30 PM Lunch (on your own)
1:30 PM to 3:45 PM Breakout Sessions
4 PM - 5 PM Invited Speaker (to be announced)
Day 2: Friday, August 5th
9 AM to Noon Workshop 1 Part 2 Workshop 2 Part 2 WriteTheDocs Part 2
Noon to 1:30 PM Lunch (on your own)
1:30 PM to 2:45 PM Breakout Sessions
3 PM to 3:45 PM Lightning Talks
4 PM - 5 PM Invited Speaker (to be announced)

Again, read about proposed sessions as well as propose your own on the interactive schedule (this opens an editable Google Document at http://bit.ly/c4lNYS16sched).

C4L NYS 2016 Code of Conduct

About the Code of Conduct

Code4Lib New York State intends to be an open and welcoming event for all who wish to participate. As such, we expect all participants will follow the Code of Conduct to be presented here. Registration and attendance at this event presumes agreement with this Code of Conduct.

C4L NYS 2016 Logistics

Where

Mann Library Rooms 160 (primary room) and 102 (workshop/breakout space). Mann Library is on the West side of the 'Agriculture Quad' on the Cornell University campus in Ithaca, New York. See the map below for getting around the Cornell campus.

When

Thursday and Friday, August 4-5, 2016. The schedule will run approximately 9 AM to 5 PM on both days, with a break for lunch on your own. A schedule will be released later this Spring, along with other logistical information.

Lodging

There are a few hotels and good AirBnB spots in the area. We are not designating a hotel or hotel block for this event, but are very happy to help with recommendations. Feel free to email Christina - see the Contact information below.

Getting to/from Ithaca and Cornell

Ithaca is in a beautiful part of the state, served by a small airport, some bus lines, and a few state roads (if driving). We will be working on getting recommended routes and directions in this section over the course of the Spring. There are also recommended parking spots and a good city bus system to help you in getting around the city while you're here.

Food, Drink & Entertainment

Ithaca has a great restaurant and nightlife scene. We will be working on getting some recommendations for you on the site in the near Spring.


Sponsors

Thank you very much to our sponsors for making this happen. If your organization is interesting in sponsoring the Code4Lib New York State 2016 Unconference, email Christina Harlow at cmh329@cornell.edu. Thank you!

Cornell University Library
